citation.article-title: Oceanobacillus oncorhynchi sp. nov., a halotolerant obligate alkaliphile isolated from the skin of a rainbow trout (Oncorhynchus mykiss), and emended description of the genus Oceanobacillus
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of genus Oceanobacillus Lu et al. 2002
Oceanobacillus (O.ce.a.no.ba.cil′lus. L. n. oceanus the ocean; L. dim. n. bacillus a small rod; N.L. masc. n. Oceanobacillus the ocean bacillus/rod).
Gram-positive, spore-forming rods, motile by means of peritrichous flagella.
Ellipsoidal spores are subterminal or terminal within swollen sporangia.
Obligately aerobic or facultatively anaerobic, obligately or facultatively alkaliphilic and grows at 0–22 % (w/v) NaCl.
Catalase and oxidase reactions are positive.
The major cellular fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0 and anteiso-C15 : 0.
The major isoprenoid quinone is MK-7.
The DNA G+C content is 35·8–38·5 mol%.
The type species is Oceanobacillus iheyensis.
